titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 2267) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1998, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 105-406, by Mr. Goss.
Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 2267.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 139.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.

During the course of debate, Mr. Hefner demanded that certain words of Mr. Cunningham's be taken down. The Clerk was instructed to report the words in question. Subsequently, Mr. Cunningham asked unanimous consent that the words in question be withdrawn and the request was agreed to without objection.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 285 - 113 (Roll no. 636).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 11/13/1997--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 2267 (Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies appropriations).
